alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cabell, southwestern Putnam and northwestern Lincoln Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hamlin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hurricane, Culloden, West Hamlin, and Salt Rock. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 30 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
